body:
> ### What do you think is the correct solution?
> In [eslint/rfcs#126](https://github.com/eslint/rfcs/pull/126) it was proposed to solve this by adding a new `meta.namespace` key to `Plugin` and have `defineConfig` rewrite the key used to reference a rule in the extended configurations. At least that is how I understood the solution, for more details, see the RFC text.

This feature is already implemented in `defineConfig`, but doesn't work in your example because `@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin` doesn't provide the `meta.namespace` property yet. The fix would be to ask that the plugin specify this property.

Here's the typescript-eslint repo:

https://github.com/typescript-eslint/typescript-eslint

When the plugin has the `meta.namespace` property specified, we can check whether this works as intended.

I see, I only checked the types defined in the ESlint project and could not find a reference to `namespace`, so I assumed that it is not yet implemented (I may have overseen them though). If that is the case, I will ask over at the typescript-eslint project instead üëç
Looks like we missed updating the types, should be fixed by https://github.com/eslint/eslint/pull/19661.

issue.title: Enhancement: Support `plugin.meta.namespace`

labels.name: accepting prs
labels.description: Go ahead, send a pull request that resolves this issue

repository.name: typescript-eslint
repository.description: :sparkles: Monorepo for all the tooling which enables ESLint to support TypeScript

body:
As suggested, I raised this to the typescript-eslint team. It does however seem like the documentation for this feature/behavior is currently missing in the ESLint docs.

I could write something up if desired, although I suspect the original RFC authors may have more context?

Or do you consider this feature still to fresh for fully publicizing it. In that case I could extend [eslint/json](https://github.com/eslint/json) to implement the `namespace` attribute first, so that there is a real plugin where this behavior can be tested on?
Oops! It looks like we lost track of this issue. What do we want to do here? This issue will auto-close in 7 days without an update.

performed_via_github_app.name: GitHub Actions
performed_via_github_app.description: Automate your workflow from idea to production

issue.title: docs: Add description of meta.namespace to plugin docs

labels.name: accepted
labels.description: There is consensus among the team that this change meets the criteria for inclusion

repository.name: eslint
repository.description: Find and fix problems in your JavaScript code.
